ok

we haven't talked a ton about ethics, however from my study of philosophy one of the things that I have learned is that of all the systems that were laid down the earlier systems make the most sense and have the most that we as Christians can learn from in my opinion, for example plato, aristotle, and plotinus, they actually teach things that can be applied to your faith in a beneficial way
like Augustine used Plato's system to develop a theology that worked
anyways, as you get to the later philosophers like kant, nietzsche, hegel it seems like there is way less application there
and they don't have a lot to talk about besides putzing around other ideas other philosophers have already thought up
they invent new ideas but they aren't beneficial
if you know what I mean
that's just what it seems like to me
I dunno, I think they do a pretty good job of clarifying stuff
like Kant's categorical imperative is a pretty elegant way of expressing right and wrong
maybe i havent stuied them enough
maybe
so since Kant believed that nothing about the real world could be truly known, should I believe his categorical imperative?
I dunno... We should talk about this sometime... but, I think right now I actually should get back to work
